blog

Mar 25, 2015

On Rejection

Rejection isn't the important part. How you handle rejection is what's important. Rejection is awful and it can really drag you down-but you don't have to let it. It's okay to be sad for a little while, but then channel that sadness into something bigger and better.

Mar 17, 2015

Logo Challenge

I had a blast with this assignment. It very much felt like a summer camp activity and it was a really fun way to get comfortable with not editing in my head. I learned that putting down the obvious, just getting it out of my system, helps me move past it and onto better design.

Mar 10, 2015

Logos and Iteration

Iteration helps you move past the obvious, explore ideas fully, and craft the best work possible. Because of iteration, I felt like I was getting to put all of my effort into the best concepts, and that's a satisfying feeling.

Mar 8, 2015

Restaurant Redesign

It sounds like a ton of work (and it was), but we kept a steady pace. Breaking it into smaller assignments to accomplish each day made the project seem much less overwhelming. As my Mama says, "the best way to eat an elephant is one bite at a time."

Mar 2, 2015

TIY Hackathon

Today marked the end of the TIY Austin Hackathon. The past four days have been some of the most demanding and challenging yet. It was our first big project to design everything on our own (and our first group project).

Feb 22, 2015

Exploring Typography

Our big homework assignment over the weekend was to create ten different typographical concepts for our restaurant project. I'm very excited about this project because we're finally designing!

Feb 19, 2015

Web Typography Codepens

Today we started talking about typography and I loved every second of it. I've been interested in typography for a while and I'm so pumped to be nerding out about it and learning as much about it as we are.

Feb 18, 2015

Responsive Sketches

RWD isn't magically going to tackle all of the challenges web designers face, but I think it's brilliant that there is a design approach that requires us as designers to think about accessibility and inclusiveness from the get go.
